programmableCalculator

Class CalculatorValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • programmableCalculator.CalculatorValue

  • public class CalculatorValue
extends java.lang.Object

    Title: CalculatorValue Class.

    Description: A component of a JavaFX demonstration application that performs computations

    Copyright: Lynn Robert Carter © 2017

    Version:
    4.30 2018-02-23 Double float implementation of the CalculatorValue class, 4.40 2018-03-23 Double float implementation of the CalculatorValue class with error terms, 4.50 2018-10-06 The implementation of a calculator showing result value and error term in single text field., 4.60 2018-11-24 Implementing the selecting the unit, so that calculation can be done by using the units., 4.70 2019-02-13 Baseline for Project 1(Data Structures).
    Author:
    Lynn Robert Carter Sumit Singh and Shivam Singhal and Sawan Gaba

        public CalculatorValue()
        This is the default constructor

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(double v,
                       double e)
        This constructor creates a calculator value based on a long integer. For future calculators, it is best to avoid using this constructor.

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(CalculatorValue v)
        This copy constructor creates a duplicate of an already existing calculator value

      • CalculatorValue

        public CalculatorValue(java.lang.String s,
                       java.lang.String e)
        This constructor creates a calculator value from a string... Due to the nature of the input, there is a high probability that the input has errors, so the routine returns the value with the error message value set to empty or the string of an error message.

      • howManyDigitsMatch

        public static int howManyDigitsMatch(UNumber newGuess,
                                     UNumber oldGuess,
                                     int maxMatchingDigits)
        This private method matches the number of significant digits in the new estimate and the previous estimate, and see if the number of significant digits that were similar in the previous run are same or not. If they are same then the further iterations are stopped and the last estimate is declared as the square root of the number, if they aren't same then one more iteration is done.This method returns the number of significant digits that matches in new estimate and the previous estimate
        Parameters:
        newGuess - - This is the new estimate
        oldGuess - - This is the previous estimate
        maxMatchingDigits - - Number of same significant digits in the last iteration
        Returns:
        maxMatchingDigits - Number of same significant digits in the current iteration

      • add

        public void add(CalculatorValue v)
        The following methods implement computation on the calculator values. These routines assume that the caller has verified that things are okay for the operation to take place. These methods understand the technical details of the values and their reputations, hiding those details from the business logic and user interface modules. All methods uses the UNumber library for computation purposes. The addition, subtraction, multiplication and division method uses the upper and lower bound technique for finding the measured value and the error term and the square root uses the Newton's method for computation of square root.

      • sqrt

        public void sqrt(CalculatorValue v)
        For square root only one operand is required, thus operation is only performed over measuredValue and operand1 error term only
        Parameters:
        v -

      • checkMeasureValue

        public static java.lang.String checkMeasureValue(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.

      • checkErrorTerm

        public static java.lang.String checkErrorTerm(java.lang.String input)
        This method is a mechanical transformation of a Finite State Machine diagram into a Java method.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string for the Finite State Machine
        Returns:
        An output string that is empty if every things is okay or it will be a string with a help description of the error follow by two lines that shows the input line follow by a line with an up arrow at the point where the error was found.
